description.narrative: Improved energy efficiency in truck freight transport
Cumulative energy savings generated from truck modernization pilots by Year 5 toe

comment.narrative: 150 toe of energy saved from truck modernization pilots
NA

description.narrative: Number of IRRs approved and enforced by Year 3

comment.narrative: 5 IRRs approved and enforced

CIUTrucking Team is on board now and office for the component has been established at the Ministry of Communication
However the Expanded Project Procurement Committee EPPC meeting held on July 302015 to identify the suitable firms and consultants to conduct the following studies
a Stocktaking of studies already carried out by ENERCON National Transport Research Centre NTRC and other organizations on applicable options for energy efficiency for truck freight transport
b Study on assessment of CO2 emissions from truck freight transport in a BusinessAsUsual BAU Scenario
c Study on assessment of CO2 emissions from truck freight transport in a LowCarbon LC Scenario And Adv for carrying out the study 312 as per AWP 2015And approved from all Concerned Quarters

description.narrative: Increased public awareness and institutional capacity on sustainable transport concepts
Number of city and provincial planners and students trained on LUP and SUTP by Year 5

comment.narrative: 30 city and provincial planners and students trained

1 Two training workshops were conducted for volunteers in May 2015 for the Inaugural Ceremony of RawalpindiIslamabadMetroBusService RIMBS
2 A poster competition involving higher education institutions on sustainable transport organized 49 posters received from 5 institutions of Rawalpindi Islamabad and Lahore
3 Project brochure notebooks mugs posters project standees folders and various other promotional materials developed and disseminated among the relevant stakeholders
4 The Project website is being regularly maintained A Facebook page for PAKSTRAN is regularly maintained which hosts updates about PAKSTRAN activities and news clips regarding the progress on the ongoing Metro Bus System and articles related to sustainable transport It also has mailing groups for project staff media and academia The total number of visit to PAKSTRAN website has reached 6306 by the end of 4th quarter 2014 The PAKSTRAN pages on social networking sites ie Facebook Twitter LinkedIn and Flicker have also been created and being maintained
5 Newsletter of first two Quarters of 2015 is almost ready to be distributed
6 A comprehensive Capacity Development Plan for the target groups in Punjab and Sindh developed through a consultative process
7 A training course on Carbon Finance with a specific focus on transport organized for 29 relevant institutions in which trained 49 people

description.narrative: Number of completed awareness raising campaigns programs by Year 5

comment.narrative: 5 awareness raising campaigns

1 A media sensitization seminar was organized in Karachi
2 A policy dialogue Urban Mobility and Transport was organized at National University of Science and Technology NUST on April 29 2015
3 Preparation for the awareness raising campaigns for 2015 has been initiated and the plan is prepared Preevent meeting was held at NED University Karachi The events will be organized after the summer breaks as Universities are closed
4 Two awareness raising campaigns organized for higher education institutions 10 in Rawalpindi Islamabad and Lahore
5 A Political Dialogue on Sustainable Urban Transport in Pakistan was organized on February 10 2015 at Marriott Hotel Islamabad The dialogue was attended by representatives of eight major political parties in the country ie PPP PML N PML Q PTI MQM JUIF JI and ANP The dialogue report is available on the website
6 A threedays June 4 to June 6 2015 awareness raising campaign was organized at Potohar Metro Bus Station I9 Islamabad
7 Detailed framework for SUTKMD centre prepared implementation is inprogress

description.narrative: Number of manuals and studies to improve infrastructure design for BRT system

comment.narrative: Existing BRT system in Punjab has deficiencies in its design and construction
Govt of Punjab adopted and implemented at least 3 manuals to improve infrastructure design and allied facilities required for the demonstration BRT system
ToRs have been developed to procure the services in order to prepare the required manuals to improve the demonstration of BRT System in the country

description.narrative: Number of operational frameworks and standard operating procedures for increased efficiencies of BRT operations

comment.narrative: Existing BRT system in Punjab has deficiencies in its operations Also no emission
Govt of Punjab adopted and implemented at least 3 SOPs and NEQs to increase efficiencies in BRT operations
ToRs have been developed for preparation of the required documentation to increase efficiencies in BRT operations

description.narrative: Number of approved integrated BRT implementation plans for selected cities in Punjab Province

comment.narrative: Lack of holistic planning for integrated BRT system in Punjab
2 approved implementation plans for integrated BRT system in 2 cities of Punjab

Government of Punjab has laid down one BRT corridor in Lahore from Shahdara to Gajumatta The Component Implementing UnitPunjab PAKSTRAN Project has floated the following consultancy services to integrate land use development along the BRT corridor from Gajjumatta to Shahdara in Lahore and to align feeder routes connecting the said corridor
1 Mapping of Land use infrastructure along the BRT Corridore1 from Gajjumatta to Shahdara in Lahore
2 Survey of public transport deployed on the routes connecting with and running along the BRT Corridore1from Gajjumatta to Shahdara in Lahore
Consultancy for study 1 has been completed
UNDP CAP has approved the case of Study 2 above Therefore the study will be initiated shortly after awarding the contract to the respective consultants

description.narrative: Number of completed feasibility studies prepared for BRT in Punjab

comment.narrative: No complete feasibility study on BRT is available in Punjab
2 feasibility studies augmented for BRT in Lahore and RawalpindiIslamabad

CAP approved bidding for the following study and is underway
Mapping of Environmental and SocioEconomic Survey along the BRT corridor I in Lahore

description.narrative: Number of institutions available for carrying out advanced research and comprehensive planning and management exercise related to sustainable urban transport SUT

comment.narrative: No institutional framework available in Punjab province
New policy framework proposing streamlining the reporting lines responsibilities and accountability for each relevant agencies Punjab Government and other institutions

MOU has been signed between the Urban Unit Punjab CIUPunjab and the UET Lahore to establish RD unit at DTEM UET Lahore UET has allocated a room in its Annex Block CIuPunjab has completed refurbishing work with the procurement of necessary IT equipments and office furniture One Research Officer and an Office Boy are on board from May 2015 The remaining vacancies have been reannounced in different national dailies It is nearly being accomplished
One week March 0913 2015 Training of Police wardens includes other City Traffic Police staff as well on Bus Rapid Transit during the construction phase has been successfully carried out 30 Police wardens attended this training

description.narrative: Number of provincial policies for developing sustainable urban transport for Sindh Province

comment.narrative: Lack of comprehensive urban transport policy framework in Sindh
1 approved Sindh provincial policy on sustainable urban transport with associated implementing rules and regulation IRRs

CIUSindh has organized a consultative workshop on 30th Dec 2014 on Principle guidelines of Sindh Urban Transport Policy The objective of this consultative workshop was to share aims and objectives of the PAKSTRAN project with relevant stakeholders and discuss the urban transport policy with them Thus the principle guidelines for Sindh Urban Transport Policy have been prepared and shared with stakeholders for seeking their inputs

description.narrative: Number of institutions available for carrying out advanced research and comprehensive planning and management exercise related to sustainable urban transport SUT

comment.narrative: Multiple entities in an uncoordinated manner are involved in SUT in Sindh
1 New policy framework proposing streamlining the reporting lines responsibilities and accountability for each relevant agencies Sindh Government and other institutions

30 consultative sessions were held with the respective stakeholders in order to propagate the theme of sustainable urban transport In addition one week 24th to 28th March 2015 articulated training was held for traffic police transport officials Motor vehicle examiners Transporters and road users

description.narrative: Number of strategic integrated urban transport plans

comment.narrative: No strategic implementable plans are available in Sindh
1 strategic plan for holistically planned integrated urban transport

After detailed consultations with GoS UNDP and PMU it was decided that Activity Result 231 Strategic plan developed including traffic management measures incorporating parking and street vendors strategy along with selected BRT route in partnership with ADB would be carried out by ADB
